Class Entity

  • java.lang.Object
    • Entity
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Ant, Gear, GrassTile, Human, Portal, Wall

    public abstract class Entity
extends java.lang.Object

    • Field Detail

      • precision

        public static double precision
        If a variable is closer to 0 than this value, then that variable is rounded to 0.

      • shape

        protected java.awt.Shape shape
        The Shape object representing the shape of this Entity.

      • grid

        protected Spacetime grid
        The Spacetime object to which this Entity belongs.

      • x

        protected double x
        The Entity's x-coordinate.

      • y

        protected double y
        The Entity's y-coordinate.

      • theta

        protected double theta
        The Entity's current angle, in radians. 0 rad is pointing right. pi/2 rad is pointing down (since y coordinates increase downwards). Pi rad is pointing left. 3*pi/2 rad is pointing up.

      • anchorX

        protected double anchorX
        The x-coordinate of the rotational center for this Entity. This coordinate is relative to the Entity's x-coordinate.

      • anchorY

        protected double anchorY
        The y-coordinate of the rotational center for this Entity. This coordinate is relative to the Entity's y-coordinate.

      • offsetX

        protected double offsetX
        The x-coordinate offset for the Shape of this Entity. This is relative to the Entity's x-coordinate.

      • offsetY

        protected double offsetY
        The y-coordinate offset for the Shape of this Entity. This is relative to the Entity's y-coordinate.

      • friction

        protected double friction
        Determines the velocity and angular velocity decrease that occurs at the end of every tick. 0 indicates no decrease (frictionless). 1 indicates immediate nullification of velocities (high friction).

      • velocity

        protected Vector2D velocity
        The current velocity of this Entity. The x-component represents the change in x-coordinate per tick, and the y-component represents the change in y-coordinate per tick.

      • angularVelocity

        protected double angularVelocity
        The rate by which this Entity rotates every tick. For example, if angularVelocity were pi/4, this Entity would rotate by pi/4 radians every tick.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Entity

        public Entity(double x,
      double y,
      java.awt.Shape shape)
        Constructs and initializes an Entity at the given coordinates, with the given shape. The shape is used for collision calculations. Sets this Entity's rotational anchor to its default value by calling the setRotateAnchorToDefault() method.
        Parameters:
        x - the x-coordinate of the Entity
        y - the y-coordinate of the Entity
        shape - the shape of the Entity

    • Method Detail

      • accelerate

        public void accelerate(double relativeTheta,
              double amount)
        Accelerates in the specified relative direction, by the specified amount. The direction is relative to the Entity's current orientation. For example, if this Entity were currently at a rotation of pi/2 rad, and the parameters (0, 1) were passed into this method, the Entity would move in the pi/2 rad direction.
        Parameters:
        relativeTheta - the angular orientation relative to the Entity's current angle, in radians
        amount - the magnitude of the acceleration

      • accelerate

        public void accelerate(Vector2D vector)
        Changes velocity as specified by the given vector. The new velocity is determined by adding the current velocity vector to the given vector.
        Parameters:
        vector - the vector to be added to the current velocity

      • accelerateSpin

        public void accelerateSpin(double deltaAngularVelocity)
        Changes the rotation rate by the specified amount.
        Parameters:
        deltaAngularVelocity - the change in angular velocity, in radians per tick

      • applyFriction

        public void applyFriction()
        Reduces the velocity and angular velocity as specified by the friction variable.

      • advance

        public void advance()
        Advances the simulation by one tick.

      • draw

        public void draw(java.awt.Graphics2D g)
        Draws the Entity.
        Parameters:
        g - the Graphics context in which to paint

      • getCenterLocation

        public java.awt.geom.Point2D.Double getCenterLocation()
        Determines the rotational center of this Entity at its current location.
        Returns:
        a Point2D.Double object containing the center coordinates

      • getRelativeVector

        public Vector2D getRelativeVector(double relativeTheta,
                         double distance)
        Returns a velocity vector specified by the given relative angle and magnitude. This vector's angle is relative to the Entity's current angle. For example, if this Entity were at an orientation of pi/2 radians, and the parameters (0, 1) were passed into this method, the vector would be at angle of pi/2 radians.
        Parameters:
        relativeTheta - the relative angle of the vector, in radians
        distance - the magnitude of the vector
        Returns:
        the Velocity object with the specified vector

      • getShape

        public java.awt.Shape getShape()
        Gets the Shape representation of this Entity at its current location and orientation. This method is used by the Spacetime class to determine collisions.

        If the offsetX and offsetY variables are equal to 0, then the current x and y coordinates represent the point at the upper-left corner of the Shape's bounding rectangle, before rotation. Another option is setting offsetX and offsetY to be equal to half of the Shape's width and height. In this case, the current x and y coordinates would represent the point at the center of the Shape.
        Returns:
        the shape of this Entity

      • getVector

        public Vector2D getVector()
        Gets the Vector2D object representing this Entity's velocity.
        Returns:
        the velocity vector of this Entity

      • isStatic

        public boolean isStatic()
        Determines whether this Entity is currently in motion. This is determined by analyzing the velocity and angular velocity.
        Returns:
        true if this Entity's velocity is zero and its spin rate is zero; false otherwise

      • notifyCollision

        public void notifyCollision(Entity instigator)
        Called by the moveEntity() method in Spacetime if a collision occurs. Default action is revert the instigator's movement, and then nullify its vectors. This method can be overridden to do whatever.
        Parameters:
        instigator - the Entity that caused the collision

      • nullifySpin

        public void nullifySpin()
        Sets the angular velocity to 0.

      • nullifyVelocity

        public void nullifyVelocity()
        Sets the velocity to 0.

      • setLocation

        protected void setLocation(double x,
               double y)
        Sets the location of this Entity to the specified coordinates. This method does not check for collisions.
        Parameters:
        x - the new x-coordinate
        y - the new y-coordinate

      • setLocationByCenter

        protected void setLocationByCenter(double centerX,
                       double centerY)
        Sets the location of this Entity based on the specified rotational center coordinates. This method does not check for collisions.
        Parameters:
        centerX - the new x-coordinate for the Entity's center
        centerY - the new y-coordinate for the Entity's center

      • setAngle

        protected void setAngle(double theta)
        Sets the angle of this Entity to the specified value. This method does not check for collisions.
        Parameters:
        theta - the new angle, in radians

      • setOffset

        public void setOffset(double relativeX,
             double relativeY)
        Sets the offset for the Shape of this Entity. In the getShape() method, the shape is translated by this offset before rotation. Shifts the rotational anchor coordinates with the offset.

        You could use parameters of (-width/2, -height/2) to make it so that the Entity's x-coordinate and y-coordinate are equal to the Entity's center. This might make calculations less troublesome. I don't know.
        Parameters:
        relativeX - the x-coordinate offset
        relativeY - the y-coordinate offset

      • setRotateAnchor

        public void setRotateAnchor(double relativeX,
                   double relativeY)
        Sets the anchor point around which to rotate this shape. These coordinates are relative to the upper-left corner of the bounding rectangle of this Entity's shape at the Entity's current location, before rotation.
        Parameters:
        relativeX - the relative x-coordinate of the anchor
        relativeY - the relative y-coordinate of the anchor

      • setRotateAnchorToDefault

        public void setRotateAnchorToDefault()
        Resets the anchor point around which to rotate this shape. The anchor point is set to its default value, which is equal to the center of the bounding rectangle of the Entity's shape before rotation.

      • rotate

        public boolean rotate(double deltaTheta)
        Attempts to rotates this Entity by the specified angle. Only proceeds with the rotation if no collision occurs at the Entity's new orientation.
        Parameters:
        deltaTheta - the angle change, in radians
        Returns:
        true if the Entity was successfully rotated; false otherwise

      • translate

        public boolean translate(double dx,
                double dy)
        Attempts to translate this Entity by the specified amount. Only proceeds with the translation if no collision occurs at the Entity's new location.
        Parameters:
        dx - the distance to move this Entity along the x-axis
        dy - the distance to move this Entity along the y-axis
        Returns:
        true if the Entity was successfully moved; false otherwise

      • translateAtAngle

        public boolean translateAtAngle(double distance,
                       double relativeTheta)
        Attempts to translate this Entity by the specified distance, at the specified relative angle. The direction of the translation is relative to the Entity's current angle. Only proceeds with the translation if no collision occurs at the Entity's new location.
        Parameters:
        distance - how far to move this Entity
        relativeTheta - the relative angle of the vector, in radians
        Returns:
        true if the Entity was successfully moved; false otherwise

      • vectorAdvance

        protected void vectorAdvance()
        Advances this Entity's location and angle based on its velocity vector and angular velocity. Does not check for collisions.

      • vectorRevert

        protected void vectorRevert()
        Reverts this Entity's location and angle based on its velocity vector and angular velocity. Basically applies the inverse of those vectors. Does not check for collisions.
